channel.title: Demonik
channel.description: Anyone have the demonik source when it was in beta? Or just the demonik source|?

item.title: Demonik
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“Sean, post:19, topic:221926”][quote author=Peter link=topic=291435.msg2348472#msg2348472 date=1216841849]

[quote author=bigh51 link=topic=291435.msg2348381#msg2348381 date=1216838683]

dam, i want a basic server that at least has the ability to run, because with all these new sources, you can’t really learn anything because you are so tempted just to edit the xmls or xp rates and release it.
[/quote]these new servers are easier to edit then just plain demonik, also if you dont know java then you wont be able to even edit/add anything to demonik so its not worth it. and for the people that do know how to code java, look at how far they got with the new sources. you basically cant do anything except edit xp rates or change xml values untill you really learn java, then you can code any source and make any source great.

Then how do you think people learn java so well? They start and start reading, and trying… Don’t say they don;t because they do.
[/quote]not by reading java code, you will never get anywhere like that.

read a book on java, read a tutorial, learn the basics THEN look at java source code and start coding. thats how its done.

Fuck off. Don’t give advice if you don’t know Java yourself.

Ugh learning a (programming) language is still learning, and people differ. Some people prefer to read a lot of books to get the knowledge and then start trying to get the experience. I myself started with browsing mIRC code. Reading other peoples scripts and simply using them until I figured out what part did what. The same with Java. Just pick the way you prefer to learn and stick with it.

Don’t have the demonik source anymore though, sorry.

What you learn from that route is very limited and dependant on the code you are reading. You wont learn proper oo concepts, understanding, design patterns, antipatterns, “tips & tricks” (how to do things properly) and pitfalls. Being able to program is more than being able to modify code to get it to work, tho a purely academical approach is neither good. What you need is a balance, without it, you are just asking for trouble (inability to start own projects via the route that you went down, and so many other moparscapers, inability to debug code or design good apis etc etc).

So, as you said.

Fuck off. Don’t give advice if you don’t know Java yourself.

Personally I find any comment like that harsh, but considering you used it yourself… get what you give.[/quote]

I didn’t tell him how to learn, I told him how I learned and I’m rather happy with how far I’ve gotten. You’re right, you don’t pick up design patterns with this way of learning, but as you develop along you start reading more also, at least that’s what I did.

Read full topic

item.title: Demonik
item.dc:creator: @auroa auroa
item.description:
@auroa wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:24, topic:221926”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=291435.msg2348425#msg2348425 date=1216840128]

I just don’t really like to copy off of someones work, you see when you play alot of servers now, you can tell rscd is the base. I already got the basics down (i think) from rs2 packaged servers. If anyone has the demonik source it would be appreciated.
[/quote]LOL you dont have the basics from rs2, rs2 is just leeching. seriously, if you EVER want to get anywhere with an rsc server, use rscdv25 or divinepk as the base, and learn java from a BOOK. rs2 coding is nothing like rsc. for rs2 an example of code would be sendMessage("rs2 code is nothing like rsc code."); whereas for rsc it would be player.getActionSender().sendMessage("rsc code is very different from rs2 code.");
also its not “copying” someone elses work, the source was released for a reason. so people can CODE it.

That’s because the void sendMessage(String) is in the same class as they are using it, which is probably some piled up shit in Client.java or so I’ve heard from rs2 servers.

This community could become average, to even good if people started TRYING to learn, asking for actual java/rsc development and gave it a go. Nobody in such long time has even tried to ask for help on something programming related, its all “how do i set up a server, help me edit some xml values” bla bla bla. If people try to do something and give it a go then the ones that know what they are doing will answer it and not flame.

Flame is given to those who post the wrong reasons in the wrong forum and/or don’t search.[/quote]
exactly, idk what this dude’s problem is. And btw, Mudclient.java, search for mc.createWindow(mc.windowWidth, mc.windowHeight + 11. Then change the name of the client fool.

Read full topic

item.title: Demonik
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:12, topic:221926”][quote author=auroa link=topic=291435.msg2348422#msg2348422 date=1216840051]
I just don’t really like to copy off of someones work, you see when you play alot of servers now, you can tell rscd is the base. I already got the basics down (i think) from rs2 packaged servers. If anyone has the demonik source it would be appreciated.
[/quote]LOL you dont have the basics from rs2, rs2 is just leeching. seriously, if you EVER want to get anywhere with an rsc server, use rscdv25 or divinepk as the base, and learn java from a BOOK. rs2 coding is nothing like rsc. for rs2 an example of code would be sendMessage("rs2 code is nothing like rsc code."); whereas for rsc it would be player.getActionSender().sendMessage("rsc code is very different from rs2 code.");
also its not “copying” someone elses work, the source was released for a reason. so people can CODE it.[/quote]
That’s because the void sendMessage(String) is in the same class as they are using it, which is probably some piled up shit in Client.java or so I’ve heard from rs2 servers.

This community could become average, to even good if people started TRYING to learn, asking for actual java/rsc development and gave it a go. Nobody in such long time has even tried to ask for help on something programming related, its all “how do i set up a server, help me edit some xml values” bla bla bla. If people try to do something and give it a go then the ones that know what they are doing will answer it and not flame.

Flame is given to those who post the wrong reasons in the wrong forum and/or don’t search.

Read full topic

item.title: Demonik
item.dc:creator: @Krypton1 Krypton
item.description:
@Krypton1 wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:21, topic:221926”][quote author=extacy link=topic=291435.msg2348660#msg2348660 date=1216848171]
How did this turn from asking for a source to “I KNOZ TEH JAVA BETR THAN UZ!” ?
[/quote]thats what id like to know. where did you all get the idea that i dont know java from? i DO know java so all of you [size=99pt]FUCK[/size] off.
to peter and sean: you may know it better than me, but i still know java, enough to tell people what is the best and FASTEST way to learn it. if people want to be idiots, and learn it slowly then thats fine but i thought people would want to learn it faster and actually understand it and what the code does.

nobody has the source anymore because its way too old. the oldest you will find is divinepk v5. can a mod please close this?[/quote]
Your an idiot, how are you to tell people the FASTEST way to learn java just because you know java. Some people like to learn different ways, and perhaps your way will take 10x longer then their own way. Why don’t you just leave auroa alone and let him learn THE WAY HE WANTS TO LEARN. Why do you care so much? And I guarantee someone has the old demonik source.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @auroa auroa
item.description:
@auroa wrote:

no a mod cant close this, it’s my fuckign topic, get the fuck out of here someone might still have it.

[quote author=auroa link=topic=291435.msg2348379#msg2348379 date=1216838579]

dam, i want a basic server that at least has the ability to run, because with all these new sources, you can’t really learn anything because you are so tempted just to edit the xmls or xp rates and release it.
[/quote]these new servers are easier to edit then just plain demonik, also if you dont know java then you wont be able to even edit/add anything to demonik so its not worth it. and for the people that do know how to code java, look at how far they got with the new sources. you basically cant do anything except edit xp rates or change xml values untill you really learn java, then you can code any source and make any source great.

Then how do you think people learn java so well? They start and start reading, and trying… Don’t say they don;t because they do.
[/quote]not by reading java code, you will never get anywhere like that.

read a book on java, read a tutorial, learn the basics THEN look at java source code and start coding. thats how its done.

Fuck off. Don’t give advice if you don’t know Java yourself.

Ugh learning a (programming) language is still learning, and people differ. Some people prefer to read a lot of books to get the knowledge and then start trying to get the experience. I myself started with browsing mIRC code. Reading other peoples scripts and simply using them until I figured out what part did what. The same with Java. Just pick the way you prefer to learn and stick with it.

Don’t have the demonik source anymore though, sorry.[/quote]

What you learn from that route is very limited and dependant on the code you are reading. You wont learn proper oo concepts, understanding, design patterns, antipatterns, “tips & tricks” (how to do things properly) and pitfalls. Being able to program is more than being able to modify code to get it to work, tho a purely academical approach is neither good. What you need is a balance, without it, you are just asking for trouble (inability to start own projects via the route that you went down, and so many other moparscapers, inability to debug code or design good apis etc etc).

So, as you said.

Fuck off. Don’t give advice if you don’t know Java yourself.

Personally I find any comment like that harsh, but considering you used it yourself… get what you give.

item.title: Demonik
item.dc:creator: @auroa auroa
item.description:
@auroa wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:15, topic:221926”][quote author=auroa link=topic=291435.msg2348443#msg2348443 date=1216840735]

[quote author=Alecks link=topic=291435.msg2348437#msg2348437 date=1216840591]

I just don’t really like to copy off of someones work, you see when you play alot of servers now, you can tell rscd is the base. I already got the basics down (i think) from rs2 packaged servers. If anyone has the demonik source it would be appreciated.
[/quote]LOL you dont have the basics from rs2, rs2 is just leeching. seriously, if you EVER want to get anywhere with an rsc server, use rscdv25 or divinepk as the base, and learn java from a BOOK. rs2 coding is nothing like rsc. for rs2 an example of code would be sendMessage("rs2 code is nothing like rsc code."); whereas for rsc it would be player.getActionSender().sendMessage("rsc code is very different from rs2 code.");
also its not “copying” someone elses work, the source was released for a reason. so people can CODE it.

Rs2d was based on the RSCD base, so it has player.getActionSender().sendMessage(String) too. But I get what you’re saying, most piece of shit rs2 sources have dumb shit like and and 10,000 if statements.

yeah big, get your facts bro.
[/quote]oh, im so sorry that i didnt know that rs2d was based on rscd just because i dont code rs2. you should still learn java first, or do us all a [size=59pt]BIG[/size] favor and get the fuck out.[/quote]
How would that be a favor rofl? I asked for the demonik source so i can start working from scratch slowly and you start saying all this shit about use the divine or rscd source and edit the xmls and xp rates. Saying people cant learn to code with java from learning source. Get your facts bro.

Read full topic

also its not “copying” someone elses work, the source was released for a reason. so people can CODE it.

Rs2d was based on the RSCD base, so it has player.getActionSender().sendMessage(String) too. But I get what you’re saying, most piece of shit rs2 sources have dumb shit like and and 10,000 if statements.

yeah big, get your facts bro.[/quote]oh, im so sorry that i didnt know that rs2d was based on rscd just because i dont code rs2. you should still learn java first, or do us all a [size=59pt]BIG[/size] favor and get the fuck out.

dam, i want a basic server that at least has the ability to run, because with all these new sources, you can’t really learn anything because you are so tempted just to edit the xmls or xp rates and release it.
[/quote]these new servers are easier to edit then just plain demonik, also if you dont know java then you wont be able to even edit/add anything to demonik so its not worth it. and for the people that do know how to code java, look at how far they got with the new sources. you basically cant do anything except edit xp rates or change xml values untill you really learn java, then you can code any source and make any source great.

Then how do you think people learn java so well? They start and start reading, and trying… Don’t say they don;t because they do.
[/quote]not by reading java code, you will never get anywhere like that.

read a book on java, read a tutorial, learn the basics THEN look at java source code and start coding. thats how its done.

so instead of encouraging me to start a source from scratch and learn as i go on, you are encouraging me to just edit xmls and xp rates… And i do know the basics of a packet-typed server from rs2d.[/quote]…
no i am encouraging you to learn the BASICS of java, then use a source such as divinepk or rscd then code it after you have knowledge of java. i didnt say anything about xml and xp rates, i said learn java THEN code.

Read full topic
